User¶

The User object does exactly what one might imagine that it does: represents human users of the platform.

class vulcanforge.auth.model.User[source]¶

Vulcan’s representation of individual human users.

SALT_LEN = 8¶
active()[source]¶
classmethod active_count()[source]¶

Get the total number of active users.

‘active’ for now means that a user is not ‘anonymous’, ‘root’ or ‘admin’

Returns:Number of active users
Return type:int

set_password(new_password, as_admin=False, set_time=True)[source]¶

Change this User’s password.

Parameters:
  • new_password (basestring) – plaintext password
  • as_admin (bool) – passed to the authentication provider (for instance as required by LDAP)
  • set_time – update the password_set_at and needs_password_reset fields of this User
